translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs, the Text on the Pairs

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sappītikaduka

original: Nasappītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasappītiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Naappītikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naappītiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na sappītikam dhammam paṭicca na sappītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na appītikam dhammam paṭicca na appītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With happiness as condition: with happiness (as condition) a wholesome thought arises, a unwholesome thought arises, an indeterminate thought arises, a wholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise, a unwholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise, a wholesome thought and an unwholesome thought arise, a wholesome thought and an unwholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise.🔽Without happiness as condition: without happiness (as condition) an indeterminate thought arises, a wholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise, a unwholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise, a wholesome thought and an unwholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise.

original: Nasappītikañca naappītikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasappītiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sappītikam ca na appītikam ca dhammam paṭicca na sappītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With happiness and without happiness as condition: without happiness (as condition) an indeterminate thought arises, a wholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise, a unwholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise, a wholesome thought and an unwholesome thought and an indeterminate thought arise. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava …pe… purejāte āsevane cha …pe… avigate nava.
